metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2181 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Anti-Replay feature in the DTLS implementation in OpenSSL before 1.1.0 mishandles early use of a new epoch number in conjunction with a large sequence number, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (false-positive packet drops) via spoofed DTLS records, related to rec_layer_d1.c and ssl3_record.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2181` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu9').
